required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison Study of Basal Bolus Therapies Together With Lispro Insulin in Type 2 Diabetes Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized Trial to Compare Basal Bolus Therapies That Use Either Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension or Insulin Glargine Together With Lispro Insulin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to look at if a basal bolus regimen of insulin lispro protamine suspension (ILPS) provides the same glycemic control as a basal bolus regimen of insulin glargine (when one basal bolus regimen is injected once daily together with insulin lispro injected 2-3 times daily).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Least Squares Mean (LSMean) values reported in the table were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, baseline HbA1C value and week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HbA1c Less Than 7.0% and Less Than or Equal to 6.5% at Endpoint
7-point Self-monitored Blood Glucose Profiles (SMBG) at Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1C value. SMBG at morning pre-meal, morning postprandial, midday pre-meal, midday postprandial, evening pre-meal, evening postprandial, 0300 hours. Postprandial glucose is measured 2 hours after the start of the meal.

LSMeans were controlled for treatment and country grouping (Mediterranean, rest of Europe). Glycemic variability was assessed as the standard deviations of 4 fasting SMBG samples, 4 post-breakfast measurements, 4 post-lunch measurements, 4 post-evening meal measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate Of All Self-reported Hypoglycemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of self-reported hypoglycemic episodes, all, non-nocturnal,and nocturnal, severe, documented ≤3.9 mmol/L and ≤3.0 mmol/L. Rate=episodes/30 days/patient/. Episode=any time a patient has a symptom associated with hypoglycemia or blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL,even if not associated with symptoms.Overall=any time post-randomization in the study period. Nocturnal=Episode between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Episode between waking and bedtime.Severe:episode in which patient requires assistance,and has glucose <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or IV glucose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Self-Reported Hypoglycemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Episode=any time a patient feels that he/she is experiencing a sign or symptom associated with hypoglycemia or has a blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL, even if not associated with signs,symptoms, or treatment. Overall=any time post-randomization visits in the study period. Nocturnal=Episode that occurs between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Episode occurring between waking and bedtime. Severe=episode with symptoms of neuroglycopenia in which patient requires assistance,and has blood glucose value <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or intravenous glucose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE)
secondary_outcome.description: A listing of adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Event module.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1C value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Daily Insulin Dose at Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1C value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Injections of Insulin at Week 24

arm_group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension (ILPS) plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections)

intervention.description: patient glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks
patient glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks
subcutaneous injections prior to meals, 24 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2
- Have been receiving metformin and at least one other oral antihyperglycemic medication (sulfonylurea or thiazolidinedione) with insulin for at least 3 months prior to Visit 1 (Screening)
- Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) greater than or equal to 7.5% and less than or equal to 11.0%
- Body Mass Index (BMI) greater than or equal to 25 and less than or equal to 45 kg/m^2
- Capable and willing to follow the protocol
- Give written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Are taking any glucose-lowering agents (other than those listed in the inclusion criteria above)
- Have a history of severe hypoglycemia in the past 6 months
- Are pregnant or may become pregnant
- Women who are breastfeeding
- Have significant cardiac disease
- Have significant renal or liver disease
- Undergoing therapy for a malignancy
- Contraindications to the study medications
- Have an irregular sleep/wake cycle
- Have a serious disease or any condition considered by the investigator to be exclusionary

group.title: Glargine
group.description: Glargine plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin

group.title: ILPS
group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin

group.title: Glargine
group.description: Glargine plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin

group.title: ILPS
group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Number of Insulin Injections/Inhalations Per Day
measure.description: The number of insulin injections/inhalations is calculated as the sum of injections per day from the most recently applied insulins before randomization.

measure.title: Body Weight
Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared.

measure.title: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
Duration of Diabetes
Previous Insulin Treatment
measure.description: The dose is calculated as the total dose from the most recently applied previous insulins before randomization.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) to Week 24
outcome.description: Least Squares Mean (LSMean) values reported in the table were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c value.
outcome.population: Per-Protocol Population: All enrolled participants who were randomized and met the following criteria: no violations of Inclusion/Exclusion Criteria have not discontinued study prior to Week 24, compliant as assessed by investigator, and have not been on systemic glucocorticoid therapy for more than 14 consecutive days.

group.title: Glargine
group.description: Glargine plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin. Participant glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks

group.title: ILPS
group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin. Patient glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) to Week 24
measure.description: Least Squares Mean (LSMean) values reported in the table were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c value.
measure.population: Per-Protocol Population: All enrolled participants who were randomized and met the following criteria: no violations of Inclusion/Exclusion Criteria have not discontinued study prior to Week 24, compliant as assessed by investigator, and have not been on systemic glucocorticoid therapy for more than 14 consecutive days.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Assuming a drop-out rate after randomization of approximately 15%, the remaining 160 patients in each treatment group should allow confirmation of noninferiority with no true treatment difference and a noninferiority limit of 0.4% using the upper limit of a 2-sided 95% confidence interval (“insulin lispro protamine suspension + insulin lispro" minus “insulin glargine+insulin lispro”) at a significance level of 0.025 with 90% power.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12 and Week 24
outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, baseline HbA1C value and week.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All participants who enrolled in this study, were randomized to 1 of the study treatments, and had at least 1 post baseline measurement for the dependent variable, according to intent-to-treat (ITT) principles.

group.title: Glargine
group.description: Glargine plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin. Participant glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks

group.title: ILPS
group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension plus Insulin Lispro (2-3 injections) plus metformin. Patient glucose-level dependent, injection, once daily in the evening, 24 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12 and Week 24
measure.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, baseline HbA1C value and week.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set: All participants who enrolled in this study, were randomized to 1 of the study treatments, and had at least 1 post baseline measurement for the dependent variable, according to intent-to-treat (ITT) principles.

analysis.method_desc: Change from baseline=Treatment+country+baseline HbA1c+week+treatment*country+treatment*week+baseline HbA1c*treatment (unstructured covariance used).
Change from baseline=Treatment+country+baseline HbA1c+week+treatment*country+treatment*week+baseline HbA1c*treatment (unstructured covariance used).

outcome.title: Rate Of All Self-reported Hypoglycemic Episodes
outcome.description: Rate of self-reported hypoglycemic episodes, all, non-nocturnal,and nocturnal, severe, documented ≤3.9 mmol/L and ≤3.0 mmol/L. Rate=episodes/30 days/patient/. Episode=any time a patient has a symptom associated with hypoglycemia or blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL,even if not associated with symptoms.Overall=any time post-randomization in the study period. Nocturnal=Episode between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Episode between waking and bedtime.Severe:episode in which patient requires assistance,and has glucose <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or IV glucose.
outcome.population: Safety population - all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

Severe=episode with symptoms of neuroglycopenia in which patient requires assistance,and has blood glucose value <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or intravenous glucose.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for >=1 nocturnal hypoglycemic episode.
p-value is for >=1 non-nocturnal hypoglycemic episode.
p-value is for >=1 severe hypoglycemic episode.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE)
outcome.description: A listing of adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Event module.
outcome.population: Safety population - all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Glargine

outcome.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 24
outcome.description: LSMean values presented were controlled for treatment, country, and baseline HbA1C value.
outcome.population: Per-Protocol Population: All enrolled participants who were randomized and met the following criteria: no violations of Inclusion/Exclusion Criteria have not discontinued study prior to Week 24, compliant as assessed by investigator, and have not been on systemic glucocorticoid therapy for more than 14 consecutive days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
